New Records: Pakistan achieved the highest successful chase ever in a World Cup by scoring 345.
Mohammad Rizwan and Abdullah Shafique both achieved career-best scores with 131* and 113 respectively.
Key Match Events: Mohammad Rizwan scored an unbeaten 131 off 121 balls and took 3 catches.
Kusal Mendis scored 122 off 77 balls for Sri Lanka.
Sadeera Samarawickrama scored 108 off 89 balls for Sri Lanka.
Hasan Ali took 4 wickets for 71 runs in 10 overs.
Haris Rauf took 2 wickets for 64 runs in 10 overs.
Dilshan Madushanka took 2 wickets for 60 runs in 9.2 overs.
Maheesh Theekshana took 1 wicket for 59 runs in 10 overs.
Post-Match Reflections: Mohammad Rizwan expressed pride in his performance and the team's belief in chasing the target.
Sri Lanka's captain Shanaka reflected on the team's performance, mentioning that they were 20-25 runs short and gave too many extras.
Pakistan's captain Babar Azam praised Rizwan and Shafique for their partnership and the team's overall performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium, Uppal, Hyderabad.
The match was part of the ICC Cricket World Cup 2023/24 season.
Pakistan won by 6 wickets with 10 balls remaining.
Mohammad Rizwan was named Player of the Match.
